text: have you ever had delicious gooey gooey
baked brie yeah did you love it have you
ever made it yourself well if you
haven't then you don't know how easy it
is to make super duper easy so today I'm
going to show you a really simple and
delicious version that we created here
at Martha I'm just unfolding a pound of
puff pastry this is all butter puff it
comes in a 14 ounce container just gonna
leave that for one second while I get
one more component ready it's 1/2 a cup
of toasted pecans I'm going to grind up
in the food processor wait to see what
I'm going to do with these nuts you want
to get them nice and fine and then what
you do is you sprinkle those toasted
pecans over one half of your unfolded
puff pastry notice I haven't rolled it
out yet I haven't done anything
I'm just unfolding it sprinkling the
nuts over one side you want to do it
it's evenly as possible so you don't
have nut clumps in essence what you're
doing is creating a whole extra layer in
your puff pastry but the extra layer is
crunchy toasty bones
spread them out you might want to leave
a little bit of an edge because now what
you want to do is take the other half of
the dough and fold it over the top of
the nuts and then pinch the edges or
just press the edges so that they seal
now what you have is dough encasing nuts
I'm gonna just flip this over and get
some flour on my parchment paper try to
get your package as even as possible and
then what you want to do is cut it
crosswise into two pieces this piece you
can set aside for just a sec I'm gonna
put it onto this baking sheet right here
and actually while I'm doing that I'm
just going to press these edges to seal
the nuts
in on this side because this was the cut
side and then do the same thing on the
piece that I have on my board and then
roll this piece out to an 8-inch square
you want to make sure that you're
working with very nice cool
little dough so that it doesn't start
sticking I like to work on a piece of
parchment paper so in case it starts to
get too warm if your kitchen is very
warm it happens sometimes you need to
throw it back in the refrigerator or pop
it in the freezer for a second it's easy
to lift up and move now what you want to
do is take your three no that's not the
supermoon it's a brie and brush it with
some Dijon mustard I'm starting with a
tablespoon for the first side brush it
all over one piece of brie like that
this is just about 1 pound turn it over
place it mustard side down and then
brush it the other side with mustard you
want a grainy mustard you could use that
I know some people who would probably
put honey mustard on here that is not
what I like but I'm not gonna telling
you if you do it I just need to set this
aside for a second this piece should get
rolled out to nine inches nine inches is
approximate you want it you want it big
enough to drape over the top of the brie
and then come to the edges so that it
can seal and I'll show you what I mean
is I'm gonna bring this here just drape
your dough over the brie and stretch it
just slightly if necessary so that it
meets on all the edges and then go
around your dough with your hands and
just sort of make sure that your brie is
fully encased in kind of a nice tight
little package so press the dough
against the edges and then cut around
the dough leaving about a half an inch
on all sides now because I want to make
this pretty I'm going to re-roll my
scraps and cut out some leaf shapes
normally I would never rear all scraps
of puff pastry because it ruins all
those meticulous layers they have
created for you but in fact when you're
making decorations it's okay for it to
be a little bit less puffy because it
maintains the designs that you put into
it better if it's actually not as puffy
so in this one instance I say it's okay
to re-roll puff pastry normally
not so much if you have time or the
inclination you can let this rest for a
little while before you start trying to
roll it out and it would be much easier
to get thin you do want your dough
pretty thin for these otherwise your
leaves will be clunky in order for your
shapes to not lose their shape once
they're cut lift your dough up and then
flop it back down and it'll spring back
on itself a little bit and then it won't
lose its shape as much because it will
already have sprung back you know when
it's bringing back after you cut your
shapes cut out some leaves maybe a
different shaped leaf it's completely up
to you what's your theme what do you
want to put on here you don't have to
decorate the top if you don't want to
but it does make it quite festive there
are my leaves very very cute if you want
to further enhance them you can use a
paring knife to score little veins in
the leaves and then transfer them to the
sheet with the brie this this whole
thing is going to go into the freezer
for a few minutes to firm everything up
if you find your decorations are getting
too soft you can actually chill them
first and then score them if you want to
might be slightly easier to work with
and they won't get pulled out of shape
with your knife get these into the
freezer for about 20 minutes to firm up
and have your oven preheating to 400
degrees okay it's nice and chilled what
you want to do now is make a little egg
wash just one egg is fine you can add a
little bit of water if you want to to
loosen it this will make it shiny it
will make golden I'm gonna actually trim
the edges just a little bit more here on
the corners I don't want this part to
burn and I thought all of a sudden it's
like you know what they might burn so
getting rid of it so now what you do is
you brush your brie all over with the
egg wash
then you can put your decorations on top
brush your cutouts with egg wash as well
you could actually do this before you
place them on there and in fact if you
wanted to you could do it before you put
them in the freezer but I like to do it
all at once
there we are and then you just get this
into your oven you want to bake it at
400 degrees for 30 minutes and then
reduce the temperature to 350 degrees
and bake it until it's golden brown and
bubbling that'll take another 20 to 25
minutes and if you need to it might be
darkening a little bit too much you can
tent it with foil is that amazing it's
so beautiful and it's so so easy you can
make this ahead you can leave it in your
refrigerator overnight and then you can
bake it off whenever you want to serve
it and everybody is gonna be completely
blown away give it a try it's baked brie
with pecans delish
[Music]
